label: 子日の遊び
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: At these Day of the Rat outings, the participants strolled about picking parsley, shepherd's purse (nazuna), and other edible plants, and pulling up tiny pine trees, which, although also edible, were valued primarily as symbols of longevity--and, because of their green color, as harbingers of spring.... In the Heian times, it was customary to go on outings to Kitano, Murasakino, or other nearby rural areas (pp. 378-9)[薺、北野、紫野]
